sub_title: PhD candidate at UMCG, Groningen NL | Deep Learning in Medical imaging, Radiotherapy | passion for AI in HealthCare
summary:
Data is fascinating and powerful, finding a way to discover what it hides is definitely what I want to do in life! Exploring medical data showed me the huge potential of AI in HEALTHCARE and I would love to be part of its realization.

>> Currently <<

I'm a PhD candidate in “Towards Personalized Adaptive Radiotherapy with Deep Learning” at the University Hospital in Groningen (UMCG), Netherlands. My project focuses on Head and Neck cancer and my main goal is to improve predictions of radiotherapy response data in order to reduce side effects in patients, during and post therapy (more details can be found below in Experience).

I am also a board member of the Machine Learning Lab Community at the UMCG. In this community we invite members to connect with other machine learning enthusiasts, share their knowledge on the latest digital health developments, and bring each other up to date on relevant events (e.g., webinars, conferences). 
If you could be interested in having a talk as a guest during our biweekly meetings, please do not hesitate to drop me a message or an email at a.de.biase@umcg.nl .

> Backgroud <

I have a Mathematical and Engineering background, my focus is on Data Science (Machine Learning, Data Mining, Deep Learning). My programming skills and my statistical knowledge allow me to follow the entire data lifecycle and transformation.

I love challenges and achieving new goals that's why I'm always motivated, hardworking, energetic and enthusiastic in what I do. Facing new realities and learning how to live on my own helped me to develop a very open mind and a strong adaptability spirit. 

I'm from Italy, I lived in Texas for a year when I was 17 and in Linkoping, Sweden, for two years, where I graduated in Statistics and Machine Learning at Linkoping University. I'm currently living in Groningen, Netherlands.

One of my favorite hobbies is traveling. I love experiencing new cultures, therefore, at the end of October 2019, I started my solo backpacking trip around South America which ended at the end of March 2020.

treasury_media.title: DASH Mini Lecture: Tumor Segmentation on Head and Neck PET/CT Images using Deep Learning
treasury_media.description: During MICCAI 2021, the #HecktorChallenge (HEad and neCK TumOR segmentation and outcome prediction in PET/CT images) was presented. The team of UMCG research, consisting of Alessia De Biase, Nikos Sourlos, Baoqiang Ma, Jiapan Guo and Wei Tang, participated in all three tasks and achieved great results. In this video, I present our entry for task one, with which we finished in 10th place, out of 42 worldwide entries.

profile_positions.description: This community has been built to support a network of machine learning researchers and developers within the UMCG. With this community, we invite members to connect with other machine learning enthusiasts, share their knowledge on the latest digital health developments, and to bring each other up to date on relevant events (e.g., webinars, conferences).
profile_positions.title: Board Member of the Machine Learning Lab Community
PhD candidate

profile_positions.description:
Exploring Deep Generative Adversarial Networks for style transfer in Medical Imaging. 

Working with Ultrasound images using Deep Learning.
profile_positions.title: Research Scientist

profile_positions.description:
Recently, deep learning models have been trained to assist pathologists in detecting
prostate cancer. However, these predictions could be improved further regarding
variations in morphology, staining and differences across scanners. An approach to
tackle such problems is to employ conditional Generative Adversarial Networks for style transfer across two different scanners. All proposed cGANs methods outperformed in AUC, in the best case the improvement was by 16%. Style transfer with CycleGAN demonstrated to be capable to improve the segmentation tool performance also preserving tissue morphology.
profile_positions.title: Master Thesis Student

profile_positions.description:
• Part of team organizing WTT (Wearable Tech Torino), the first Italian event on Wearable Technologies;

• As a Media Partnership Manager I managed to create leads and opportunities
with the most relevant editorial groups in Italy, allowing the project to reach an
audience of more than three million people in Italy localized in the fields of
technology and innovation.

J.E.To.P. is the Junior Enterprise of the Politecnico di Torino University, it's a no-profit organization that aims to fill the gap between studies and work. 
Founded in 1995 in one of the most prestigious universities of Italy and Europe, J.E.To.P. has always renewed thanks to his proactive members which are students coming from all the fields of engineering and architecture.
